author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
Refusing to intervene in the ongoing row over the JNU Students’ Union president Kanhaiya Kumar being slapped with the sedition case, the Delhi High Court on Tuesday dismissed a petition seeking a probe by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) into the entire affair.

Rejecting the petition filed by Lucknow-based lawyer Ranjana Agnihotri, a Bench comprising Justice Manmohan said it was “premature”, as the investigation by the Delhi Police could not be faulted so soon. There was no reason to assume that the Delhi Police were incompetent to handle the case, said the court.

The petitioner had sought transfer of the probe to the NIA claiming that the police were not properly investigating the case The Bench, expressing confidence in the competence of the Delhi Police, observed that the Union government had powers to take suo motu action under the NIA Act, 2008, should it find it fit to do so.

Petitioner’s counsel Hari Shankar Jain said the investigation should be handed over to the NIA as it was a sensitive matter.
title: HC rejects plea for NIA probe
